...and the only saving grace is Dreaming of Spring, when the growth and warmth returns, bringing hope of spring with storms that rumble through with sweet rain. I can feel myself start to grow as everything begins the upward journey. As I hope to do one day, the flowers blossom with beautiful colors and warmth. If you listen carefully, you can hear the bird calls and warm sun-kissed breezes inviting us closer to summer.

As with all my music, enjoy your own journey and discoveries - here are mine.

name: Countryside Stroll
description:
Countryside Stroll is an album about a place and time in Montana, old stomping grounds, impressions and memories.

Countryside Stroll - relaxed and easy going, as if back home in Montana.
Glassified - sheer view, with longing to move faster into a scenic soundscape.
Cowboy Quandry - open spaces, on the range facing the elements, harsh winters.
In The Snow - drifting, floating, blizzard and quiet stillness in a vast and crisp scene.
Leaves - gold leaves are falling.
Op. 17 - a little fun, almost a smile.
Inside November - cool air, warm sun .
Sleepy Guardian Angel - overworked, always on call, this very tired angel watches, keeps her person safe, and tries to stay awake.
The Traveler - moving through time, searching with a heavy heart as realizing new dimension, higher plane of knowledge, drudgery, continuing into eternity.

As with all my music, enjoy your own journey and discoveries - here are mine.

name: Holiday Frost
description: Simple and peaceful arrangements of Christmas carols for flute accompanied by strings and things. There are 5 original holiday songs: Cari's Carol, Sleepy Guardian Angel, Holiday Frost, Icicles, and Snowflakes. Each hold a dear and fragile memory, so many emotions to share in celebration of the holiday season.

name: In a Cosmic Daze
description:
In A Cosmic Daze

Music is our way of expressing ideas that, for whatever reason, cannot be totally expressed or understood in any other forum. We all have had the experience of listening to music that has touched us, but we really can't say why and so we go on about our day effected and somehow changed. If you try to "demystify" music you might say that it is a collection of frequencies vibrating in certain patterns and even on that level it is connected with our universe. Scientist talk about string theory and how all things are vibrating strings of energy that make up the cosmic symphony that is our physical world, so it is no wonder that music has such a huge part in our daily lives. This collection of songs is a musical metaphor of how time presents itself to us.

If you have ever waited, in great anticipation, for someone to arrive or something to happen then you know that sweet emotion that might take pages of text to explain but music can evoke that feeling in a few seconds of listening. Bach's music makes us feel unwavering power of life by a steady tempo and sure relentless melody. Music that is slightly behind the beat makes us feel as though we want to hold time back, like when someone must leave soon, but we want them to stay just a bit longer. This collection explores those ideas.

With out clocks, the Celtic people had a keen idea of the passing and metering of time. They regarded the "time between times" as magical moments to be cherished. These hours were dusk and dawn, solstice and equinox. Although in our lives we have clocks, cell phones and computers telling us the current time and day, it is important to have a few hours to let that go and sit and smell the rain and let the stress of the week go.

Music can do so much for us as your week builds from Monday through Sunday, these pieces can give you some quiet time to breath and to find joy. Though music we can all relax in our time between times and reconnect to the cosmos in a real human way.

name: Light and Shadow
description: Cari Live is Intelligent New Age music. With Light and Shadow is presence and absence existing at the same time. There seems to be a parallel to life, sometimes a fine line between one and the other. This is a journey of one soul, discovering the soft morning light as a source of life while accepting the shadows at night as they lurk in tired thoughts. At the end of the day, there is a serenity in the settling dusk.... time seems to slow down and give refuge to the scattered dreams.

name: Meditations_
description:
Meditations: Lush green windswept hills. Gentle drizzling rain. Looking out from a warm bed on a frosty winter's morning. Dreams of breaking fog across layers of ocean waves. The sweet smell of a crisp sunny day. Leaning on a fence, watching clouds float across an evening sky, shades of grey, rose, and yellow ebbing away as the sun descends into the horizon.

A mare and foal settling down for the night. Close, silent, nuzzling each other to make sure each ones place of sleep is shared and safe. Moonlight drifting over barns and silos. Touching each hillock with it's translucent light. A lake in moonlight. Fading diamonds sparkling their last light before the darkness sips them up and away. Warm honey dripping from a sleeping child's fingertips. A blissful smile at the edge of her mouth, puffs of air barely moving the whisps of hair lying across her cheek.

A darkened sky at the very edge of daybreak. Still. Vacant. The faint promise of light at the edge of the land. Trees barely seen. Grasses unmoving. Flowers yet to bloom. Softness and gentleness resting in the sighs of the earth yet asleep. Nothing astir, no roaming or movements yet of fawns lying under sheltering cover. The edge of night closing around a cottage small. Golden light flickering through curtains drawn, the beginnings of night's dance toward the dawn. Chimney smoke escaping into the frigid air. White against the midnight sky. Disappearing upwards, curling, spirals, then gone. A father's peek into his son's darkened room.

The sound of the child's dreams once caught on a fright, then released in play. Silent quivers under lids tightly closed. The only sign of dreams forming and fading within a child's heart.

Written for Cari Live by Britt O'Hollaren

name: Mindreader
description:
Mindreader: thoughts and visions of others, ideas, constantly interpreting. As with all my music, enjoy your own journey and discoveries - here are mine:

"Wandering thoughts" : persistent focused ideas interrupted by distractions of the day, memories, and projections

"Try to Keep An Open Mind" : emotional turmoil attempts to alter and cloud the thoughts of the day

"Psychic Pads" : constant babble in ones mind, persistent and maybe borderline ?

"Moebius Strip" : continuous, revolving, twisted path, returning to the starting point.

"Op. 16" : playful, almost happy

"It's Just a Daydream" : a simple pastime turns into a drama of epic proportions, demanding action for an imaginary audience.

"Crystal Ball" : inspired by a memory of a song but frozen in a different time, cloudy but full of emotions of another lifetime.

name: Rising Above
description:
Rising Above album is inspired by a piece of art work, a simple smiling face, that generates a sense of peace.

Stay - a reminder for peace of mind, to be in the moment and experience the now.
Blue - sometimes music present colors.
And Around - flute and piccolo in a waltz, turning and spinning round and around. Clarinet, Viola and cello are brought in to dance as it rains outside (listen closely for the birds chirping outside my studio when the storm passes.)
October Dream - a daydreamer from an early age, this melody takes a life of its own with the longing and wishful tone of the flute.
Waiting - what can be added to such a title? Seemingly endless time in anticipation, hoping and wondering, lifted up by expectations, feeling disappointment, but must persevere
Rising Above - transcend, that moment of release from worry, surrender

As with all my music, enjoy your own journey and discoveries - here are mine.

name: Space Flute
description:
For some people, the beauty of the cosmos is enough. Looking up from the floor of a desert or a high mountain plateau at night can be breathtaking. The mysterious realm of that outer world goes back not only to the early days, but to each of our childhoods.

It is somewhat ironic that the more we know space in which our earth exists, the more questions we have. Could it be that it might be the last unanswerable question? These unanswered questions are the bases for more spiritual thoughts that rise up not so much to a deity but only to ask where are we and what is our place here in the cosmos.

As we learn more and more about string theory and how we are all parts of the same thing a set of vibrating strings of energy one may think that the wonderful harmonies of Space Flute is tapping in as all music does to that cosmic vibrations of our lives. Night 24, for example, seems to make those connections, as if Cari Live has received that musical flame from Faure and Debussy and is using it in the 21st century.

name: Wabi Sabi
description: Wabi-Sabi is underplayed and modest, the kind of quiet, undeclared beauty that waits patiently to be discovered... ?

name: Impressions
description:
Every song in Carlos"s second New Age album tells a great story depicting a life impression that will take you to a journey through your inner self.

The use of various acoustic and ethnic instruments create a subtle combination of serene-sounding passages elevated by the beauty of soothing voices. The album has a great flow and iterates smoothly between songs until the end. It is initially pushed by the warmth of a beautiful acoustic piano with the tenderness of an angelical voice, evolving to more intense passages featuring crisp acoustic guitars, ethnic percussions, and the sweetness of the violin to create heart-warming melodies that will take you to a peaceful and relaxing state of mind.

The use of various cultural sounds adds a tremendous amount of flavour to the arrangements creating a very distinctive yet sublime effect. Subtle touches are always present throughout the album meticulously mixed to take the listener into a visionary experience.

name: Sea to Sky
description:
A perfect blend of acoustic and ethnic instruments, with evolving textures and delicate passionate voices. Detailed arrangements and meticulous recordings bring New Age music to a new level.

Featuring award-nominated and two-time finalist song Farewell. Emotion, passion, serenity, are only a few of the feelings that this music will evoke within you. As the album name suggests, something as grandiose as nature is intended to be reflected with every note in this music.

The album has a great flow thanks to the unique feel to each song that seldom overstay its welcome. In terms of uniqueness, the album is initially pushed by soothing voices and the warmth of the strings, to the beauty of haunting piano melodies joined by the deep and resonating sound of the cello. The album alternates between different sounding passages until it reaches its end; but each iteration is warm, peaceful, and engaging on a relaxing level.

name: Zirkus - Step Inside - Piano Music of Robert Schumann
description:
For aficionados of psychedelic 19th century Romanticism and Golden Era keyboard heroes.

This long-awaited recording is his first studio release in eight years. If you love the old-school keyboard heroes such as Horowitz, Rubenstein, Lhevinne, Moiseiwitsch et al, with big technique, myriad tonal colors and supersized style, then Zirkus is for you!

Reviews:
"Those wise enough to slip this CD into their collection will be rewarded with a truly magnificent rendition of [Robert Schumann's] Kreisleriana."
James Wegg, www.jamesweggreview.org
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Cary Chow/Zirkus - Step Inside - Piano Music of Robert Schumann/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Cary Chow/Zirkus - Step Inside - Piano Music of Robert Schumann/cover_200.jpg

name: Someday You Will Be Proven Correct
description:
Caustic Casanova are eclectic, electric, and hard. The manner in which they channel heavy metal, psychedelic rock, and quirky songwriting into this original and at times unpredictable album is not to be trifled with. Play VERY LOUD for best results.

Here is the very long, weird and literary version of album notes, in the form of a letter to the Magnatune listener:

Tremulous grew my mistrustful heart when of a cold and dark evening not some time ago did there come a knocking most exigent at the grand door of my family's estate may long it prosper and suffer forfeiture of monies at only the slimmest of taxation rates. As the hour was such as suits only earthbound spirits and those most desperate brands of hooligans, the household all had retired to their chambers for a night's restorative slumbers save mineself, who, unable to taste that sweetness of a momentary respite from consciousness, had, as is oft my want in times of harrowing solicitousness and incapacitating encumbrance, sought safe haven and refuge in the comforting bosom of my beat lab may long it prosper and yield fruits bearing only the slinkiest of grooves all borne in the name of sweaty, pulsating bodies and so accordingly 'twas I tasked with the chore of answering this unnerving mesonoxian summons. For a solitary moment doth I waver upon the threshold of my Kingdom of Sound; yet with a flourish forth ventured I.

'Twas a cloaked figure I greeted at the gate with prudence. Verily I tell thee, what a vexing sight! No features could I discern, to no vestige of form could I affix a common humanity; still, a strange and unchecked calm did I feel washing o'er mine heart in spite of my sensible mind's sizable alarm. This inscrutable soul held aloft in one hand a flourishing torch, as if some substantial journey was in medias res and this incandescence was a friend, lover, and guide, all entwined in one; cradled in the nook of the other arm was a package. With nary a word did this wraith pass to me this bundle so sacredly carried, before departing with burdened purpose and immediacy from whence it had come.

Return to the friendly confines of the beat lab doth I, and to the task of deciphering the nature of that curious artifact which in mine hands I held I set. 'Twas a lovely creation, shot through with all of heaven's most alluring shades, the richest of melancholy indigos and wistful violets, bearing as caption the queer cipher:

CAUSTIC CASANOVA SOMEDAY YOU WILL BE PROVEN CORRECT

Partnered with this striking piece of art found I a letter. 'Twas a charter from the governing members of one Mad Love Records granting mineself sole proprietorship o'er the crafting of a treatise heralding the essence of this "album" to the fervent patrons of Magnatune. Harrumph, doth I humphed. What a rude and uncivilized gesture, so unbefitting a gentleman of my substantial station may long I prosper and concoct hypnotic rhythms that will populate Swiss raves with beautiful people 'til nigh eternity to receive an unsolicited commission of this nature! And at such an unholy hour in such a haunting fashion! Most nonplussed doth I find mineself, yet, being a man of reason and not inconsiderable learning I took no rash action in the fires of my distemper, and instead proceeded to perform the only rational action the moment afforded: Upon the mercy of my beat lab's absolute world class sound system I placed the fate of this mysterious record, come what judgment may.

Ninety-five one-hundredths of an hour later stirred I from what surely be the most magical and splendid moments of mine two ears' existences may long they prosper and share with me regal riffs and magisterial melodies. O, I swear to thee, such music! Such contradictions! Felt I pummeled and uplifted, ransacked and soothed, moved in body and mind, all from the same orchestra's concoction!

And so now gather I my thoughts on this radiant LP, so deftly recorded and engineered by Sir J. Robbins may long he prosper and set loose his magpies' songs upon the globe so expertly mastered by Baron Bob Weston may long he prosper and succeed in every Mission he undertakes so superbly written and played by Lady Stefanie Zaenker and Lords Francis Beringer and Michael Wollitz may long they prosper and enchant the masses with their holy choral endeavors. Ye who gather here reading these words face a momentous decision: Doth thou spend thy hard earned wages upon these tunes? All I can tell thee, as plainly as do have I in my power, is this: Thou, a conjurer of worlds, a creator of portals, a grasper of procurements from the great beyond, Use thy Magic Machine to call forth from dimensions yet unconquered these gallant arias, that thine great halls might too be filled with commanding canticles eve after glorious eve, that thou might yet become a better, more harmonious soul on account of what thou encounters here.

Yours In Ever Faithful Devotion To The Bounteous Glories Beheld In The Sphere Of Independent-Minded Rock, Leonard Calvert
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Caustic Casanova/Someday You Will Be Proven Correct/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Caustic Casanova/Someday You Will Be Proven Correct/cover_200.jpg

name: Failure
description:
Failure is an album that touches on old school hip hop, pulses to the beat of electro, and has an underlying industrial flare that threads tribal moods into its mix. This collection of cool and groovy tracks will take you back to early electronic music roots while upholding a fresh new polished modern dance floor edge.

Benny E. Sanches (aka Cavalcade) is a native Texan and has been producing, remixing and recording for over two decades. Cavalcades collaboration and production credits include Depeche Mode, Meat Beat Manifesto, Cabaret Voltaire, Mikey Dread, Bermudez Triangle, WeatherHouse, Velapene Screen, LoFeye and George Cochrane to name a few. Now based in the Echo Park community of Los Angeles, Benny presents yet another intelligent, beat-driven body of work.

name: The Variable EP
description:
The Variable EP is a collection of experimental excursions by electronic music pioneers from the past to the present. The concept of this project was for each artist to personally select a song from Cavalcade's new album Dare to Think, and to reinterpret those songs with no particular theme in mind.

The interesting result is tracks 2, 3 and 4 with a special guest appearance by Meat Beat Manifesto on track 1. Track 5 is Cavalcade's answer to George Cochrane's remix of "Filthy", a sort of tag team remix effort by the two. It is with honor and respect for Benny E. Sanches (aka Cavalcade) to host this body of work by some of his biggest influences in the world of electronic music.

name: Flesh of the Witch
description:
"Flesh of the Witch" follows the emotional odyssey of a damaged and dangerous man who finds love in the form of a darkly sensual, mysterious woman accused of witchcraft.

This epic tale allows the mood of each scene to dictate the style of the music utilized. Moving through the genres and sub-genres of rock, heavy metal, and more traditional music styles, Ceremony of Darkness provides a multi-layered spectrum through which the story of "Flesh of the Witch" can be experienced, rather than forcing the story into a set of rigidly selected songs.

Based out of St. Louis, MO, Ceremony of Darkness has not taken the traditional route to success. Rather than follow trends, they define the core of their music by its diversity which is on full display in "Flesh of the Witch."

ln 2010, Ceremony of Darkness burst onto the scene with their debut album "13" by winning Best Metal Album in the Independent Music Awards, while also being honored with a nomination for Best Metal Song in the Hollywood Music in Media Awards for "The Surgeon of New Orleans." Determined to build upon the success of "13" Ceremony of Darkness endeavored to create "Flesh of the Witch," a conceptual album designed to feature not only great individual songs, but to also provide a complex musical journey rarely experienced in the modern age of music.
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Ceremony of Darkness/Flesh of the Witch/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Ceremony of Darkness/Flesh of the Witch/cover_200.jpg

description: The premier album by melodic heavy rock band Ceremony of Darkness "13", grants the listener a view into dark rock with a strong metal influence. Unique among albums the standard hard rock/metal genre the vocals and musicianship mold to fit the purpose and imagery of each song creating a diverse collection of tracks. Deeply stirring and unrelentingly sexual, "13" dwells in the shadows of the complex soul. Haunting vocals and layered guitars weave a tapestry of imagery and emotion on an intense journey through desire and darkness.

name: Another Ride
description:
Another Ride (nominated for a San Diego Music Award in 2007) uses the same techniques as his soundtrack work to fuse Latin sounds and rhythms with the acoustic pop melodies that were inspired by influential recording artists both in the U.S. and abroad.

Farran's interest in Brazilian culture makes an impressive influence on Another Ride, as he weaves stories of love found and love lost with the rhythms that enchanted him on his travels throughout that country. The Brazilian styles of Samba, Bossa Nova, Reggae, Forro, and Maracatu can all be heard in his songs, as he showcases his talents on the instruments he collected and brought back.

name: On Surfari Sessions Volume 1
description: Chad Farran travelled the world with the crew of the TV series On Surfari to find inspiration to compose these original scores full of unique ethnic instrumentation, rhythms and grooves.

name: Autumn Suite Volume 1
description:
Mixing classical guitar and piano in an inspired blend of Classical, New Age and Jazz, focussed on the moods of Autumn. This album returns to the experimental element of Summer Suite, Vol One Chad Lawson and Troy Conn (guitar) push the outer edges of the envelope with this improvisational recording. The opening track Autumn Suite I is the only 'rehearsed' piece from the album while Autumn Suite II and III are entirely improvised.

"A fascinating study of the create dynamics between to artists as well as the amazing musicality that can result from this sort of collaboration."
Kathy Parsons, MainlyPiano.com

name: The Chopin Variations (on piano, violin and cello)
description:
Steinway artist, Chad Lawson, decided Chopin needed a new introduction. Along with violinist Judy Kang (Lady Gaga, Ryuichi Sakamoto) and cellist Rubin Kodheli (Kanye West, Courtney Love), Lawson has arranged ten Chopin works into a modern day interpretation. It's a risk editing the "poet of the piano" but one that Chopin would be proud of.

Lawson's previous release, "The Space Between", debuted at #12 on Amazon's Adult Contemporary while Olafur Arnalds named it in his Top 5 of 2013. Prior to, The Space Between, Lawson's release, The Piano (2011), reached #19 on iTunes Classical. Chad has been a featured guest on NPR's Talk of the Nation, PRI/SiriusXM's Bob Edwards Show, toured with Julio Iglesias and can be heard on Delta Airlines In-Flight radio programming.
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Chad Lawson/The Chopin Variations (on piano, violin and cello)/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Chad Lawson/The Chopin Variations (on piano, violin and cello)/cover_200.jpg

name: The Chopin Variations (on solo piano)
description:
Steinway artist, Chad Lawson, decided Chopin needed a new introduction. Along with violinist Judy Kang (Lady Gaga, Ryuichi Sakamoto) and cellist Rubin Kodheli (Kanye West, Courtney Love), Lawson has arranged ten Chopin works into a modern day interpretation. It's a risk editing the "poet of the piano" but one that Chopin would be proud of.

Lawson's previous release, "The Space Between", debuted at #12 on Amazon's Adult Contemporary while Olafur Arnalds named it in his Top 5 of 2013. Prior to, The Space Between, Lawson's release, The Piano (2011), reached #19 on iTunes Classical. Chad has been a featured guest on NPR's Talk of the Nation, PRI/SiriusXM's Bob Edwards Show, toured with Julio Iglesias and can be heard on Delta Airlines In-Flight radio programming.
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Chad Lawson/The Chopin Variations (on solo piano)/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Chad Lawson/The Chopin Variations (on solo piano)/cover_200.jpg

name: Set on a Hill
description:
In Lawson's debut solo piano album, listeners learn that the space between the notes can be more important than the notes themselves. From the one simple tone introduction of the album, to the engaging shimmering movements and singsong melodies as the album draws to a close. "Produced by the legendary Will Ackerman, this is one of the few piano albums he has done that is strictly solo piano.

"The open spaces are almost as important as the notes in Lawson's music, and I can't imagine any of these nine pieces as anything but solo piano."
Kathy Parsons, MainlyPiano.com

Produced by Will Ackerman (Grammy Winner/Founder of Windham Hill)
Album of the Year - Whisperings Solo Piano (2009)

name: A Solo Piano Christmas
description:
A fireside conversation by award winning pianist/composer, Chad Lawson. 10 solo piano Christmas classics; perfect for any holiday setting. Solo Piano Christmas is a collection of ten Christmas carols arranged for solo piano by Chad Lawson and played to perfection with his smooth and elegant touch.

Nominated for Christmas Album of the Year - SoloPiano.com

name: Song of Prayer
description:
"I can't put into words what your music expresses; it is far more than beautiful," states one YouTube commenter about pianist Chad Lawson's latest offering, Song of Prayer.

Visiting Seattle in July 2011, "the Lord really laid it on my heart to record something that people could use during prayer," Chad recalls. Lawson invited a close friend to record him, let the Lord place his hands wherever He wanted to and 32 minutes later, it was done... No preparation, no outtakes, no overdubs: improvisational prayer in its rawest, most honest form. (Lawson kept a hymnal with him on the piano while recording "just in case" but he never had to open it).

Lawson never planned on recording this, it found him: Chad plays three morning services every Sunday at a large church in North Carolina. Each service has some time set aside for quiet prayer, where Lawson plays solo. After one quiet time, as soon as the pastor started speaking, Lawson was stunned: "There was an authority in his prayer, a genuine crying" not with loud action, but with sincere words." Lawson found out he had been reading directly from the Puritan book of prayers and meditation, Valley of the Vision. The inspiration for "Song of Prayer" was born.

name: The Space Between
description:
With his previous release, The Piano, reaching #19 on iTunes Classical and selling out on Amazon 4 times in less than 2 weeks, independent artist Chad Lawson had grown tired of the "pretty sounding piano" recordings as of late. So, one afternoon, Lawson sat down and write The Space Between in one complete setting. The only exceptions were 'Heart in Hand' (composed for upcoming film) and 'A Love is Born' (written for an automobile commercial).

Lawson was recently featured on NPR's Talk of the Nation which catapulted The Space Between to #12 on Amazon's Adult Alternative charts and has drawn unbelievably high praise from critics as being both daring and breathtaking all in one.

name: Summer Suite, Vol One
description:
Chad Lawson's solo piano album, Summer Suite, strikes an evocative balance of musical flow and visual metaphor. With economical accompaniment from percussionist Jim Brock, Summer Suite unfurls in ten suite-like movements that mirror not only the passage of the season, but in a deeper sense the passage of time, and how themes of mediation, rumination, freedom and play can provide comfort, solace, and release.

Entirely improvised in a lone 31 minute session, Summer Suite appeals to listeners in a personal way, each one able to add their unique interpretation as the album evolves. To some, touches of a Bach fugue or a Bobby Timmons like jazz cadence will be felt, to others, a rolling, Americana styled melody or East European folk song will come to mind. There are also moments of twilight absorption, where stillness and meditation are as powerful as a flurry of notes cascading across the musical landscape.

"Lawson pulls off something tricky with Summer Suite, engrossing the listener with simple, involving melodies while also freeing him or her to let their minds roam. Freedom is key as with the best memories of summer."
- Ken Micallef, DownBeat

name: The Piano
description:
From the opening variation of J.S. Bach's Prelude in C Major, to Lawson's own originals drawing from his early classical studies, The Piano is beautifully simple and unadorned from the first note to the last ringing of the last sustain.

"Gorgeous soft, subtle, sensual touch that not only picks up where his stellar debut left off but has also raised his game. The Piano is very clear and strong evidence that Chad Lawson is already a major player in the solo piano circles."
Michael Debbage - MainlyPiano.com

"Lawson's playing defines "velvet touch," and he often approaches the piano with the French Impressionists' ideal - playing the piano as though it doesn't have hammers. A classically-trained pianist with an extensive jazz background, Lawson can do it all when it comes to music, but his original solo piano work is nothing short of sublime."
Kathy Parsons - MainlyPiano.com

"Album of the Year (Classical)"
- SoloPiano.com (2011)

name: Canto y Danza
description:
Canto y Danzais a program of songs and dances of Spain. For the first time since the 16th century, a matched set of four vihuelas can be heard to play the polyphonic instrumental fantasias and vocal music from the golden age of the Spanish Renaissance.

The music for this program has been taken from all of the seven surviving books of vihuela music, with at least one piece from each book being represented. Soprano Carrie Henneman Shaw is the featured singer with Edward Martin, Phillip Rukavina, Rockford Mjos, and Tyler Kaiser playing the vihuelas.

The vihuela is a guitar-like instrument that was developed and used in Spain during the 16th century. The most popular stringed instrument in Europe was the lute, but, because of the association of the lute with the Moorish population in Spain, the Spanish musicians were not allowed to use the lute. In order to compose and play the polyphonic music that was popular in the day, they developed an instrument that was tuned and played like a lute, but did not look like a lute: and the vihuela was born.

The music on this recording is adapted from works that survive in the sixteenth-century printed vihuela books. There is at least one piece from each of the surviving seven sources, and ten of the seventeen works include voice, sung by Carrie Henneman Shaw. The arrangements have been made by ensemble member Tyler Kaiser, closely modelled on the music of the original tablatures, constructing the instrumental parts with reference to the original vocal music where relevant, following principles learned from study of the Vallet lute quartets, and applying embellishment drawn from theoretical sources such as Diego Ortiz's Tratado de glosas of 1553. The six pavanas of Luis Milan (tracks 1, 5, 6, 8, 12 and 15) have been converted from solo pieces to ensemble works with glosas added and represent the kind of solemn dance music that was used as processionals in formal entries in Spanish courts and households, as well as for social dancing.

Full song translations, program notes and a description of the instruments can be found in the accompanying artwork.

name: Dark Transport
description:
Dark Transport is a 10-track song cycle written in Gozo (a small island off Malta) at a time of great emotional change. The record is soaked in the sounds of the Mediterranean, with its heady mix of crossing cultures between mainland Europe and North Africa. Lyrically influenced by the concept haiku, without adhering to its strict rules, the words sketch ambiguous instructions and images that sit within music, acknowledging textures over strict tempos.

'DARK TRANSPORT' is coming off the back of the last album 'The Room is Empty', an album which, in 2007, spent 9 weeks in the US CMJ music chart and was licensed to MTV's news and documentaries dept, as well as to numerous shows on the same station and Oxygen.

name: The Airs of Wales
description:
Drawing a serene yet luminous sound from the harp, Cheryl Ann Fulton shines on her best-selling The Airs of Wales, an aptly named album of feather-light grace and clarity. Fulton's selections keep a peacefully joyous mood throughout, and it's perfect music for any time you want to create a refined yet amiable mood. It's also the perfect alternative to traditional Christmas music, as the overall sound is as wintry and delicately lovely as a snowflake.

The history of both the harp and the music is included in the download.
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Cheryl Ann Fulton/The Airs of Wales/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Cheryl Ann Fulton/The Airs of Wales/cover_200.jpg

name: The Once and Future Harp
description: More worldly and yet contemplative than any harp music you have likely heard up until now, the Magnatune best-seller The Once and Future Harp features the subtle, sophisticated compositions of Cheryl Ann Fulton in a crystal clear recording that shows her to be at the height of her powers. This particular selection of pieces for harp ranges from medieval to modern. The elegance of the melodies and Fulton's sparkling performances give this recording a luminous, transcendent quality. In addition to the many solo pieces featured here, "The Poet" is a beautifully cascading duet with a viola da gamba.
cover: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Cheryl Ann Fulton/The Once and Future Harp/cover_400.jpg
cover_small: http://he3.magnatune.com/music/Cheryl Ann Fulton/The Once and Future Harp/cover_200.jpg

name: Controlled Chaos
description:
Grungy vocals and monster metal riffs mixed with plenty of catchy hooks and beautiful melodies. Lyrics tell real stories of life, death, love, betrayal, hate, violence, addiction and alienation in a world that seems more and more chaotic every day. Man's compulsive need to destroy himself and everything surrounding him never seizes to amuse.

chILL's music can be described as "controlled chaos". Catchy rock blends seamlessly into modern metal. The band's goal is to make internationally competitive music without any kind of restrictions or preconceptions, and to create something genuine and special in these times of superficial recycled entertainment. All the solutions in their music are not necessarily always by the book and they shouldn't have to be.

In March 2007 the band took a creative break from live shows, and started writing and recording material for their debut album: "Controlled Chaos". Almost a year passed until it was time to break the silence with an explosion.

chILL's 11-song debut album was recorded by Miska Rautiainen at the band's own "Twisted Studios" and was mixed by Finnish Sami Koivisto at Biotech Audio Solutions (Koivisto has mixed many Finnish bands like "Waltari", "Nicole", "Deathbound" and "Havoc Unit").

name: Megaton Robotic Apple Pie
description:
On their newest album "megaton robotic apple pie", indie-rock heroes Chinaski deliver another infectious, signature album with crunchy low end guitars, interwoven bass lines, and thunderous drumming. With wide-ranging influences and qualities explained by the band as, "the threatening crunch of Sabbath, the spring-coil tightness and groove of the Jesus Lizard, and the atmospherics of the Doors," the band reaches far beyond the typical rock genre to a place that can only be understood through sound.

The songs on the album range from the darkly jazz-inflected groove of "There Is A Place" featuring Lomet's dramatic vocal presence, the angular and explosively blues-tinged "Highway 61", the strummy and harmony-laden "One More Lie", and the aggressive driving darkness and operatic fury of "Frontline." The lyrics hint at politics, but could also be personal. The words lining the songs are neither directive nor dogmatic. No message blares forth. And yet, its understood.

The massive low end of their sound comes from the chunky bottom of Cudahy's guitar, paired with McCoy's bass lines, and anchored by Weinstein's sinewy drumming. It's a sonic foundry of thick guitars and pounding rhythms set off by a straight-shooting lead vocal. Chinaski rocks with more power and finesse than bands twice their size and wattage, which when all is said and done, really is the bottom line.

Combining the driving rhythms and guitar barrage of early 90's alternative rock with a song- writing style that falls just left of the mainstream, Chinaski has a simple approach to rock... that rock itself shouldn't be so simple.

Chinaski is a literary character created by Charles Bukowski. He valued alcohol and the madmen and women of the world. He lived to create and illuminate the underbelly of Los Angeles. Disgusted with the mundane and conventional people surrounding him, he left his readers with a cleansing honesty. That honesty is reflected in the music of this band.

Instrumentation:
Bruce Lomet: Vocals and Guitar
Dan Cudahy: Guitar
Collyn McCoy: Bass Guitar
Dave Weinstein: Drums

name: Megaton Robotic Apple Pie (instrumental)
description:
Welcome to the instrumental version of their newest album "megaton robotic apple pie", indie-rock heroes Chinaski deliver another infectious, signature album with crunchy low end guitars, interwoven bass lines, and thunderous drumming. With wide-ranging influences and qualities explained by the band as, "the threatening crunch of Sabbath, the spring-coil tightness and groove of the Jesus Lizard, and the atmospherics of the Doors," the band reaches far beyond the typical rock genre to a place that can only be understood through sound.

The songs on the album range from the darkly jazz-inflected groove of "There Is A Place", the angular and explosively blues-tinged "Highway 61", the strummy and harmony-laden "One More Lie", and the aggressive driving darkness and operatic fury of "Frontline."

The massive low end of their sound comes from the chunky bottom of Cudahy's guitar, paired with McCoy's bass lines, and anchored by Weinstein's sinewy drumming. It's a sonic foundry of thick guitars and pounding rhythms set off by a straight-shooting lead. Chinaski rocks with more power and finesse than bands twice their size and wattage, which when all is said and done, really is the bottom line.

Combining the driving rhythms and guitar barrage of early 90's alternative rock with a song writing style that falls just left of the mainstream, Chinaski has a simple approach to rock... that rock itself shouldn't be so simple.

Instrumentation:
Bruce Lomet: Guitar
Dan Cudahy: Guitar
Collyn McCoy: Bass Guitar
Dave Weinstein: Drums

Chinaski is a literary character created by Charles Bukowski. He valued alcohol and the madmen and women of the world. He lived to create and illuminate the underbelly of Los Angeles. Disgusted with the mundane and conventional people surrounding him, he left his readers with a cleansing honesty. That honesty is reflected in the music of this band.

name: You Might Like This Better Than Me
description:
On their debut CD, indie rock heroes Chinaski deliver an infectious, signature album with crunchy low end guitars, interwoven bass lines, and highly active sinewy drumming. Combining the driving rhythms and guitar barrage of early 1990's alternative rock with a song writing style that often falls just to the left of mainstream sensibilities, Chinaski has a simple approach to rock...that rock itself shouldn't be so simple. It's a place where they swing a little more and they rock a little harder.

"Stark, minimal, direct; the album kicks off with the power bass groove of "I Will." Immediately establishing the script for the album: intelligent lyricism, no-frills musicality, and a straight shot directly into the listener. "I Will" was recently featured on an episode of the TV show "The Gilmore Girls". This utilitarian aggregation has intriguing hints of jazz around the edges; the band has a propensity for unusual time signatures, unexpected rhythmic turns, and drop-dead endings. Standout songs include the neo-psychedelic "C.V.R.," enhanced by spoken word narration "This is your captain speaking," the singer intones, "I'll see you on the ground"; The jazz-inflected "Our Song" featuring a swampy breakdown; the stunning "Hollywood" - featuring a hypnotic, polyrhythmic pulse throughout, evoking the seamy boulevards lined with tattered palm trees and cold neon."
- Dan Kimpel (Author and one of the American media's foremost authorities on pop music and songwriting).

name: You Might Like This Better Than Me (instrumental)
description:
Welcome to the instrumental version of their debut album, You might like this better than me. Indie rock heroes Chinaski deliver an infectious, signature album with crunchy low end guitars, interwoven bass lines, and highly active sinewy drumming. Combining the driving rhythms and guitar barrage of early 1990's alternative rock with a song writing style that often falls just to the left of mainstream sensibilities,

Chinaski has a simple approach to rock...that rock itself shouldn't be so simple. It's a place where they swing a little more and they rock a little harder.
